intro: Rinorea ledermannii, commonly known as the red-flowered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Rinorea ledermannii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
